headline: FOREX-Евро падает: слабые данные PMI поддержали ожидания о снижении ставки ЕЦБ
news:
ЛОНДОН/СИНГАПУР, 23 сен (Рейтер) - Евро снижается в паре
с долларом в понедельник - данные деловой активности нарисовали
мрачную экономическую картину еврозоны и подстегнули ожидания,
что ЕЦБ будет и дальше снижать ставки в 2024 году.
    Единая валюта <EUR=EBS> к 15:30 МСК упала на 0,4% до $1,111.
    Данные S&P Global показали, что деловая активность в
еврозоне неожиданно сократилась в сентябре, так как доминирующая
в блоке сфера услуг оказалась в минусе, а спад в
производственном секторе усилился.
    Спад оказался широкомасштабным: снижение в промсекторе
Германии углубилось, и экономическая активность во Франции
вернулась к сокращению после августовского подъема, вызванного
Олимпиадой.
    "Данные, безусловно, оставляют открытой дверь для снижения
ставки в октябре, а вот войдет ли регулятор в эту дверь, пока
говорить рано. В любом случае это довольно мрачные данные", -
сказал Кеннет Бру из Societe Generale.
    "ФРС США переключила свое внимание с инфляции на рост, и ЕЦБ
в какой-то момент тоже сделает этот переход".
    Трейдеры нарастили ставки на смягчение денежно-кредитной
политики ЕЦБ в 2024 году до 44 базисных пунктов с 38 б.п. на
прошлой неделе, что означает более высокую вероятность шага
вниз в октябре.
    Индекс доллара к корзине из шести основных валют <=USD>
вырос на 0,22% до 101​.
    ЦБ Великобритании в четверг сохранил процентную ставку без
изменений, при этом глава регулятора Эндрю Бейли сказал, что
центробанку нужно проявлять осторожность, чтобы не снизить
ставки слишком быстро или слишком сильно.
    Фунт стерлингов <GBP=> опустился на 0,14% до $1,3303​. 
    Швейцарский франк <CHF=> был стабилен на уровне 0,8499​. 
    Японская иена <JPY=> к доллару подорожала на 0,1%​ до
143,76.
    Правящая партия Японии выберет нового лидера и,
следовательно, нового главу правительства 27 сентября. Смена
премьер-министра усложнит работу центробанка вне зависимости от
того, кто победит, вдобавок ожидается, что на конец октября
будут назначены досрочные общенациональные выборы.
    Австралийский доллар <AUD=> подорожал на 0,34% до $0,6829​.
    "Киви" <NZD=> поднялся на 0,26% до $0,6253​. 
    Юань на материковом рынке <CNY=D3> был малоподвижен на
уровне 7,0545​, на офшорном рынке <CNH=> - подешевел на 0,27% до
7,0594. 
    Биткоин <BTC=> вырос на 1,1% до $63.504, ранее в течение
сессии коснувшись минимума одного месяца в $64.730.
    Эфириум <ETH=> поднялся на 4,32% до $2.650,2.
    
    Оригинал сообщения на английском языке доступен по коду:
[nL4N3L50M6]

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
World FX rates    https://tmsnrt.rs/2RBWI5E
The BOJ continues to hold    https://reut.rs/4e8zxKl
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^>
 (Видья Ранганатан в Сингапуре и Шрути Шанкар в Лондоне)

headline: BUZZ-FX options wrap - CNH puts, RBA risk, GBP bulls, EUR outlook
news:
FX option implied volatility is lower since the 50bps U.S. rate cut and
expectations of more easing and a soft landing, which should limit the FX
volatility potential before the U.S. election. 
    USD/CNH risk premiums have fallen over recent months and Goldman Sachs notes
a more favourable reward versus risk for owning certain topside strike options
to benefit/hedge the risk of trade tariffs if Donald Trump wins the Nov. 5 U.S.
presidential election. 
    The Reserve Bank Australia is almost unanimously priced to leave interest
rates on hold at 4.35% on Tuesday. Overnight expiry AUD/USD FX option implied
volatility trades its lowest pre RBA risk premium of 2024 at 13.0 - reinforcing
those expectations with a lack of related FX volatility risk premium.  
    The scope for further GBP/USD gains might be limited when looking at
options. Demand for topside strike GBP/USD options is relatively tame and the
benchmark 1-month expiry risk reversal contract is struggling to retain a rare
GBP call over put implied volatility premium. 
    EUR/USD 1-month risk reversals have failed to threaten August's long term
high implied volatility premium for EUR calls over puts at 0.3 post Fed. The
contract was sold at 0.1 EUR calls on Monday and when combined with a lack of
topside demand and lower implied volatility, could signal a lack of impetus to
take EUR/USD higher. 
    Plenty of big G10 FX option strike expiries this week might help to
draw/contain FX spot.     
    
    
    For more click on [FXBUZ]

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
GBP/USD FXO 1-month expiry 25 delta risk reversals    https://tmsnrt.rs/3XP9JgJ

headline: 更新版 1-中國匯市：人民幣收創逾16個月新高，“政策禮包”行情料延續至國慶前
news:
* 
      人民幣收升逾200點，與中間價同創逾16個月新高
    

        * 
      中國金融監管祭出政策大禮包，市場情緒備受提振
    

        * 
      匯價午後升破7.04關口，國慶前料維持穩中偏強
    

        * 
      中國貨幣政策恢復彈性，人民幣中期前景向好
    

  
 (新增評論及收盤報價)

       路透北京9月24日 - 人民幣兌美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周二收升逾200點，與中間價同創16個月新高。交易員指出，中國超預期推出金融政策“大禮包”，市場情緒備受提振，人民幣午後升破7.04元關口，預計國慶假期前維持穩中偏強。
    
    他們並表示，短期市場將繼續消化本輪經濟刺激政策，市場信心修復也有利於經濟復甦；而且隨著美聯儲進入降息周期，中國貨幣政策恢復彈性，有望更好支持實體經濟，這也令人民幣中期前景向好。
    
    “今天市場興奮起來，預計樂觀情緒會延續到國慶假期前，”一中資行交易員稱。

    另一中資行交易員認為，今天各項政策都超出市場預期，預計短期人民幣還會維持偏強態勢，“現在對政策很有期待，也許後續還會出來其他政策。”   
     
    
    中國金融監管層今日宣布一系列經濟刺激舉措。央行送出降準+降息+降存量房貸利率的“大禮包”，並統一首套房和二套房的房貸最低首付比例。
    
    此外，中國央行首次創設支持資本市場的結構性貨幣政策工具，首期額度分別為5,000億和3,000億元人民幣，並稱“如果用得好”，未來可視情況擴大規模。受此提振，中國股市滬綜指周二收盤飆逾4%，創四年多來最大單日漲幅，並連續第五個交易日收漲。
    
    央行行長潘功勝在發布會上並表示，隨著國內外貨幣政策周期差的收斂，人民幣匯率基本穩定的外部壓力明顯減輕；將強化預期引導，要防止匯率市場、外匯市場形成單邊、一致性預期並自我實現，保持人民幣匯率在合理均衡水平上的基本穩定。

    全球匯市方面，澳元周二升至今年以來的最高水平，因澳洲央行重申了其抑制頑固通脹的決心。[FRX/CN]
    
    法國外貿銀行(Natixis)資深經濟分析師Gary Ng表示，中國需要一個低利率環境來提振信心；鑒於美聯儲更加趨於溫和，中國可能更願意啟動新一輪寬鬆的政策周期。
    
    以下為今日在岸市場人民幣兌美元<CNY=CFXS>收盤價、中間價<CNY=PBOC>，以及離岸市場人民幣的主要報價： 
    
 在岸市場人民幣兌美元(16:33分)        今日          上日         升貶
        即期官方收盤價<CNY=CFXS>     7.0385        7.0587          0.29%
                中間價<CNY=PBOC>      7.051        7.0531          0.03%
              日內波動幅度(pips)       322        日低7.064   日高7.0318

headline: MORNING BID AMERICAS-New highs beckon as China eases, Europe sneezes
news:
A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike
Dolan
Wall Street looks set to grind out another record on Tuesday as
world markets were enlivened by long-awaited monetary easing in
China - rate cuts aimed at underpinning a wobbling economy
that's sowing weakness across the world, not least in Europe.
    Chinese stock indexes <.CSI300> <.HSI> surged more than 4%
on Tuesday and the offshore yuan <CNH=> hit its strongest level
against the dollar in 16 months after a series of moves by the
People's Bank of China to loosen lending conditions.
    Less than a week after the Federal Reserve's outsize half
point rate cut, PBOC boss Pan Gongsheng said banks' reserve
requirement ratio would be cut by 50 basis points, freeing up
about 1 trillion yuan ($142.21 billion) for new lending. 
    Aimed at shoring up the ongoing property bust and dousing
fears of wider deflation, the RRR cut came in tandem with a
20bps cut in the one-week reverse repo rate to 1.5% as well as a
series of other key lending and mortgage rate cuts. 
    The sweeping, if long delayed, measures included cutting
minimum down-payment rates on new homes and capital market props
and swaps making it easier for funds and brokers to buy stocks.
    Whether the moves hit home remains to be seen. Geopolitical
headwinds, for one, continue to stiffen as the U.S. Commerce
Department on Monday proposed prohibiting key Chinese software
and hardware in connected vehicles on American roads due to
national security concerns.
    China's slowdown - which this month seen many banks and
investment funds slash growth outlooks to well below Beijing's
5% target- has infected the industrial world at large. 
    Nowhere is that clearer than in Europe's alarming business
contraction in September, according to flash business surveys
published on Monday. And at the heart of that is waning German
confidence, where Ifo's September survey of German firms on
Tuesday missed forecasts yet again.
    German business morale fell more than expected for a fourth
consecutive month, the survey of around 9,000 managers found.
    China's latest stimulus, however, proved a shot in the arm
for European stocks <.STOXXE> - which gained almost 1%, led by
surges in basic resource <.SXPP> and luxury goods <.STXLUXP>
sectors. 
    The euro <EUR=> recouped a large chunk of Monday's retreat.
    Although the chance of a European Central Bank cut as soon
as October crept higher on Monday, it remains less than 50%.
    Back on Wall Street, Monday's September business surveys
also showed ongoing struggles in the factory sector - but,
unlike in Europe, brisk service sector activity continued to
show a healthy overall expansion of the private sector.
    That has retained faith in the soft landing theme, with the
S&P500 <.SPX> eking out another record high on Monday and
futures are up smartly again ahead of the bell.
    With some 75bps of additional Fed easing this year now
priced into rate futures and Fed officials sounding dovish,
two-year Treasury yields <US2YT=RR> hovered about 3.60% on
Tuesday ahead of a $69 billion auction later in the day. The
two-to-10 year yield curve <US2US10=RR> continued to steepen to
a new two-year high of 18bps. 
    Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee said on Monday that he
expects "many more rate cuts over the next year".
    September U.S. consumer confidence readings are next up for
examination later in the day.
    Elsewhere, Japanese markets returned from Monday's holiday
in fine fettle, with the Nikkei <.N225> up 0.6% and the yen
<JPY=> slipping to its lowest in almost three weeks.
    Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda told business leaders the
central bank will raise interest rates if trend inflation
accelerates as projected - but appeared unrushed and claimed the
BOJ can "afford to spend time" scrutinising services prices,
financial markets and overseas developments.
    The Reserve Bank of Australia, meantime, continued to toe a
relatively hard line and held its policy rate steady on Tuesday
- though at least governor Michele Bullock said further
tightening was not up for discussion.
    The Australian dollar <AUD=> hit a nine-month high of
$0.6869 on the decision but later retreated on Bullock's
comment.
    
Key developments that should provide more direction to U.S.
markets later on Tuesday:
* U.S. September consumer confidence, Richmond Fed September
business survey, July house prices, 
* Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman speaks; Bank of
Canada Governor Tiff Macklem speaks; Dutch central bank chief
and European Central Bank policymaker Klaas Knot speaks 
* US corporate earnings: Micron Technology, Autozone  
* US Treasury sells $69 billion of 2-year notes
* United Nations General Assembly in New York

ailing factories    https://reut.rs/4dmQdMZ

headline: On Tuesday 24th of September Dongfeng Electronic trades 10.05 percent higher
news:
On Tuesday 24th of September Dongfeng Electronic trades 10.05 percent higherSep 24, 2024

Dongfeng Electronic (600081.SS) traded up 10.05 % during a 24 hours period ending at 11:41 AM Central Europe on Tuesday 24th. One Dongfeng Electronic stock can currently be bought for about CNY 9.2 on popular exchanges. Current supply of Dongfeng Electronic stocks is 553.4 mn. Dongfeng Electronic has a current market capitalization of CNY 5 bn and approximately CNY 103.3 mn worth of Dongfeng Electronic was traded on exchanges in the last 24 hours. Since last month end, Dongfeng Electronic has traded 10.45 % up. Simple moving average of last 200 days is at CNY 9.62. The highest price of past 52 weeks was recorded at CNY 13.83 on 11/29/2023. 52 weeks low was at CNY 6.95 on 02/06/2024.

Here is how related stocks have performed in the past 24 hours:

- Mubang High-tech (603398.SS) traded down -8.06 % and now trades at CNY 15.15. Mubang High-tech has a market capitalisation of CNY 6 bn.

- Zhejiang Jiecang Linear Motion (603583.SS) traded down -1.48 % and now trades at CNY 15.87. Current market capitalisation for Zhejiang Jiecang Linear Motion is CNY 5.9 bn. Zhejiang Jiecang Linear Motion has a current price to earnings ratio of 18.89. Title: Zhejiang Jiecang Linear Motion Technology: Technical Analysis and Outlook Investors may be eyeing Zhejiang Jiecang Linear Motion Technology Co Ltd (ZJLMT) for its potential growth opportunities, given its strong fundamentals and technical indicators. As of September 23rd, 2024, the stock has been trading steadily with its last closing price at 15.5 CNH. Looking back at the company's historical performance, ZJLMT has shown significant upside potential over the past year. Its 52-week high of 22.93 CNH was reached on May 8th, 2024, while its 52-week low of 12.87 CNH was seen on February 5th, 2024. This range represents a substantial increase of 96.4% from its lowest point to its highest point during this period. Currently, ZJLMT is trading above its 50-day moving average (MA) of 14.33 CNH and its 200-day MA of 16.47 CNH, indicating a bullish trend. Moreover, the stock's Relative Strength Index (RSI) stands at 58.67, suggesting that it is neither overbought nor oversold, providing room for further growth. From a valuation perspective, ZJLMT's price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio is 19.17, which is slightly higher than the industry average. However, its price-to-book (P/B) ratio of 1.41 indicates that the stock is undervalued compared to its peers. These ratios suggest that investors may be missing out on an opportunity to buy into a fundamentally sound company at a discounted price. Technically speaking, ZJLMT appears to be consolidating within a symmetrical triangle pattern, which could indicate a breakout towards the upside. If the stock manages to breach the upper boundary of the triangle around 18.5 CNH, it could potentially reach its next resistance level at 20.5 CNH. On the flip side, a break below the lower boundary of the triangle around 14.5 CNH could lead to a pullback towards the support level at 13 CNH. In conclusion, Zhejiang Jiecang Linear Motion Technology Co Ltd seems poised for continued growth based on its technical and fundamental analysis. Investors looking for a solid long-term investment may consider adding ZJLMT to their portfolios, but should always conduct thorough research before making any investment decisions.

- Ningbo Yongxin Optics (603297.SS) traded down -2.48 % and now trades at CNY 56.33. Current market capitalisation for Ningbo Yongxin Optics is CNY 6 bn. Ningbo Yongxin Optics has a current price to earnings ratio of 27.37.

- Beijing Capital Development (600376.SS) traded down -0.85 % and now trades at CNY 2.39. Current market capitalisation for Beijing Capital Development is CNY 6 bn.

- Cwb Automotive Electronics (605005.SS) traded up 0.34 % and now trades at CNY 15.02. Current market capitalisation for Cwb Automotive Electronics is CNY 6 bn. Cwb Automotive Electronics has a current price to earnings ratio of 23.27. Title: CWB Automotive Electronics: Technical Analysis Reveals Mixed Signals Investors looking to gain a foothold in the booming automotive electronics market may want to take a closer look at CWB Automotive Electronics Co Ltd (CWEB), a Chinese firm that has been making waves with its innovative technology solutions. Despite a lack of recent news, a technical analysis of the company's performance paints a mixed picture of its potential. Current Price and Past Performance As of September 24th, 2024, CWEB's last closed price stood at 14.9 CNY, down from its 52-week high of 24.59 CNY recorded on November 28th, 2023. However, this decline has not deterred investors, as the stock has still seen significant growth over the past year, with a 52-week range of 11.3 CNY to 24.59 CNY. This volatility suggests that the company's future performance could be influenced by various factors, including changes in consumer demand and technological advancements. Price to Earnings Ratio and Price to Book Ratio One key metric that investors often consider when evaluating CWEB's performance is its price to earnings ratio (P/E ratio). Currently standing at 23.27, this figure indicates that the stock is trading at a premium compared to its peers, suggesting that investors have high expectations for the company's future earnings growth. Additionally, CWEB's price to book ratio (P/B ratio) of 3.28221 implies that the stock is undervalued based on its assets, which could be an attractive opportunity for value investors. Technical Indicators When examining CWEB's chart patterns, several technical indicators provide insights into the company's short-term and long-term prospects. For instance, the Relative Strength Index (RSI) currently stands at 61.8%, indicating that the stock is neither oversold nor overbought, suggesting a neutral stance. Similarly, the Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) signal remains bullish, with a positive crossover hinting at continued upward momentum. However, the Stochastic Oscillator reveals that the stock is approaching overbought territory, which could lead to a correction or consolidation period in the near future. Conclusion While CWEB's recent lack of news may raise concerns among investors, a technical analysis of the company's performance highlights both positive and negative signals. With a premium P/E ratio and undervalued P/B ratio, the stock appears to be attractively priced for those willing to take on some risk. However, the stock's volatility and approach to overbought territory suggest caution may be warranted before jumping into the fray. As such, investors should carefully weigh these factors before making any decisions regarding their investment strategy.

-----------

About Dongfeng Electronic

Dongfeng Electronic Technology Co., Ltd. is a Chinese company that specializes in manufacturing and marketing various motor vehicle parts and instruments. These include sensors, bearings, valves, and other related auto parts. Through its subsidiaries, the company also operates in the automobiles and parts trading sector. Their official website is www.detc.com.cn and they are listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange. Their Initial Public Offering (IPO) date was June 16, 1997.

headline: EMERGING MARKETS-Стимулы в Китае подтолкнули акции развивающихся рынков к пику 2-х лет
news:

на 1% во вторник, когда ЦБ Китая объявил крупнейший со времен
пандемии комплекс мер стимулирования экономики  В то же время
форинт замер в ожидании решения ЦБ Венгрии о ставке.

одного месяца.

    В то же время японский фондовый индекс Nikkei <.N225>

headline: Aussie Jumps as RBA Holds Steady, Markets Lifted by China's Stimulus Push
news:
Aussie Jumps as RBA Holds Steady, Markets Lifted by China's Stimulus PushAustralian Dollar surged broadly today following RBA's decision to leave interest rates unchanged at 4.35%, as widely expected. What caught the market's attention was RBA's continued focus on inflation risks, making it clear that the central bank is not considering a rate cut anytime soon. During the post-meeting press conference, Governor Michele Bullock downplayed the [...] Australian Dollar surged broadly today following RBA's decision to leave interest rates unchanged at 4.35%, as widely expected. What caught the market's attention was RBA's continued focus on inflation risks, making it clear that the central bank is not considering a rate cut anytime soon. During the post-meeting press conference, Governor Michele Bullock downplayed the significance of tomorrow's monthly CPI data, describing them as volatile and less reflective of the underlying inflation trend. Nevertheless, she clarified that the board did not explicitly consider a rate hike at this meeting, signaling a steady approach for now

The broader market mood was lifted by China's announcement of an unexpectedly large stimulus package. The package includes a forthcoming 50 bps reduction in the reserve requirement ratio for banks, along with a cut in the seven-day reverse repurchase rate from 1.7% to 1.5%. Furthermore, PBoC indicated an intention to cut loan prime rates by 20 to 25 basis points, although the timeline for these moves remains unclear, and the details remain sparse. Additional measures were announced, such as reduced down payments for second homes, aimed at stimulating the property market. This is seen as China's most significant stimulus move since the pandemic's onset, but skepticism remains over whether the new measures will be sufficient to fully revitalize the struggling economy.

Overall in the currency markets, Australian Dollar continues to lead the pack, buoyed by both RBA's stance and positive risk sentiment from China's stimulus actions. New Zealand Dollar and Canadian Dollar also posted gains, reflecting broader risk-on sentiment. Meanwhile, Euro has fallen to the bottom of the performance chart after disappointing PMI data fueled speculation of a ECB rate cut as early as October. Japanese Yen and Dollar are also struggling, weighed down by a lack of safe-haven demand. Sterling and Swiss Franc sit in the middle of the currency performance spectrum.

Technically, USD/CNH is now eyeing an important fibonacci level as down trend from 7.3745 (2023 high) extended. Some support could be seen from 100% projection of 7.3679 to 7.0870 from 7.3111 at 7.0302 to bring rebound. But firm break of 7.1364 resistance is needed to confirm short term bottoming. Otherwise, rise will stay on the downside. Decisive break of 7.0302 could prompt downside acceleration to 161.8% projection at 6.8566, even if fall from 7.3679 is just the third leg of the long term pattern from 7.3745.

In Asia, at the time of writing, Nikkei is up 0.83%. Hong Kong HSI is up 3.58%. China Shanghai SSE is up 3.55%. Singapore Strait Times is up 0.31%. Japan 10-year JGB yield is down -0.0421 at 0.822. Overnight, DOW rose 0.15%. S&P 500 rose 0.28%. NASDAQ rose 0.14%. 10-year yeild rose 0.011 to 3.739.

RBA holds rates at 4.35%, remains vigilant on inflation risks

RBA kept the cash rate target unchanged at 4.35% today, as widely anticipated by markets. The central bank stated that data since the August Statement on Monetary Policy have "reinforced the need to remain vigilant to upside risks to inflation." Maintaining its stance of "not ruling anything in or out," RBA emphasized its determination to return inflation to target levels and affirmed it will "do what is necessary."

Regarding the inflation outlook, RBA noted that headline inflation is expected to "fall further temporarily" due to federal and state cost-of-living relief measures. However, it does not foresee inflation returning sustainably to the 2–3% target range until 2026. This suggests that while short-term relief is expected, underlying inflationary pressures remain a concern over the medium term.

Japan's PMI manufacturing dips to 49.6, services rises to 53.9

Japan's PMI manufacturing index ticked down from 49.8 to 49.6, marking its third consecutive month in negative territory. On the other hand, services sector offered some relief as its PMI edged higher, rising from 53.7 to 53.9. Composite PMI slipped from 52.9 to 52.5, indicating a slight softening in growth momentum.

Usamah Bhatti, Economist at S&P Global Market Intelligence, noted that Japan's private sector expansion carried on through Q3, though at a slower pace. The expansion remained services-led, with the sector showing its strongest growth in five months, while manufacturing output fell back into contraction for the second time in three months.

Bhatti also highlighted that input cost inflation has eased to a six-month low, with both manufacturing and services firms reporting softer cost pressures. However, service providers are increasingly passing higher costs onto customers, as output price inflation ticked up slightly in September. Confidence in the future remains positive, but the overall sentiment has weakened to its lowest level since April 2022.

Fed's Goolsbee signals multiple rate cuts ahead as focus shifts to employment

Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee suggested at an event overnight that Fed will likely implement "many more rate cuts over the next year" as it shifts its focus from inflation to employment concerns.

Goolsbee further noted that a proactive approach is necessary to avoid potential disruptions in the labor market. "It's just not realistic to wait until problems show up," he said, highlighting the need for Fed to avoid being "behind the curve" in managing economic risks.

While the timing of the initial rate cut may be less critical, Goolsbee stressed the importance of a "longer-arc view" to ensure favorable conditions for both inflation and employment. He pointed out that "rates need to come down significantly going forward" to maintain economic stability.

Looking ahead

Germany Ifo business climate is the main feature in European session. Later in the day, US will release house price index and consumer confidence.

EUR/AUD Daily Outlook

Daily Pivots: (S1) 1.6182; (P) 1.6302; (R1) 1.6370; More [http://www.actionforex.com/markets/pivot-points] ...

EUR/AUD's fall from 1.7180 resumed by breaking through 1.6256 support. Intraday bias stays on the downside for 61.8% projection of 1.7180 to 1.6256 from 1.6629 at 1.6058, which is close to 1.5996 key support level. On the upside, above 1.6315 minor resistance will turn intraday bias neutral first. But outlook will remains bearish as long as 1.6629 resistance holds.

In the bigger picture, outlook is mixed up by the deeper than expected fall from 1.7180. Yet as long as 1.5996 support holds, up trend from 1.4281 (2022 low) is still in favor to resume at a later stage. Firm break of 1.7180 will pave the way to 61.8% projection of 1.4281 to 1.7062 from 1.5996 at 1.7715.

headline: FOREX-Госстимулы Пекина толкнули юань вверх, "осси" растет на фоне ястребиного ЦБ Австралии
news:
ТОКИО/ЛОНДОН, 24 сен (Рейтер) - Юань достиг 16-месячного
максимума во вторник после объявления властями Китая новых
стимулирующих мер - энтузиазм на рынках и способствовал также
росту евро. "Австралиец" поднялся до максимума 2024 года -
центральный банк Австралии вновь подтвердил решимость бороться с
упрямой инфляцией.
    Индекс доллара к корзине из шести основных валют <=USD> к
15:35 МСК снизился на 0,18% до 100,75​.
    Обещанные главой ЦБ Китая денежно-кредитные стимулы, включая
запланированное снижение на 50 базисных пунктов нормы банковских
резервов (RRR), сигналы о возможности большего смягчения
кредитных ставок, а также меры поддержки рынка недвижимости
способствуют росту юаня.
    Юань на офшорном рынке <CNH=> подорожал на 0,45% до 7,0285. 
    Чувствительные к изменениям в китайской экономике активы,
такие как акции, сырьевые товары и евро, также укрепились.
    "Это хорошая новость для этих валют, особенно для евро, она
позволяет отвлечься от внутренних проблем", - сказал Крис
Беачампс из IG.
    По его словам, решение Федеральной резервной системы США на
прошлой неделе о значительном снижении ставки на 50 базисных
пунктов дало другим центральным банкам, включая китайский,
"прикрытие" для начала снижения собственных ставок.
    "Нарратив начинает разворачиваться, и обстановка может
быстро измениться, если перейти от разговоров о рецессии в США к
тому, что Федеральная резервная система успешно управляет
экономикой, а теперь к этому подключается и Народный банк
Китая".
    Центральный банк Австралии во вторник не стал менять уровень
процентных ставок, повторив при этом - вразрез с риторикой
Федрезерва США, начавшего кампанию смягчения неделю назад, - что
денежно-кредитная политика должна оставаться жесткой.
    "Сегодняшнее решение ЦБ Австралии равносильно еще одному
ястребиному выпаду, что совпадает с нашим мнение том, что еще
слишком рано производить голубиный разворот ДКП, - сказал Тони
Сикамор из IG. - Тем не менее, возможность снижения ставки в
декабре сейчас недооценена".
    Австралийский доллар <AUD=>, который часто выступает в
качестве ликвидного прокси для юаня, подорожал на 0,28% до
$0,6857​. Ранее в течение дня "осси" коснулся $0,68695 - самого
высокого уровня с 28 декабря, но затем отступил, после того как
глава ЦБ Австралии Мишель Баллок сказала, что повышение ставки
не обсуждалось на заседании.
    "Киви" <NZD=> поднялся на 0,45% до $0,6293​. 
    Японская иена <JPY=> к доллару подешевела на 0,26%​ до
143,97 - глава ЦБ Японии Кадзуо Уэда повторил в выступлении во
вторник, что центральный банк может позволить себе потратить
время на тщательное изучение событий на рынках и в зарубежных
экономиках, прежде чем проводить дальнейшее ужесточение
денежно-кредитной политики.
    Евро <EUR=> вырос на 0,23% до $1,1138​, несмотря на то что
во вторник были опубликованы неблагоприятные данные о
настроениях немецких инвесторов за сентябрь.
    Фунт стерлингов <GBP=> поднялся на 0,25% до $1,338​,
достигнув пика с марта 2022 года. ЦБ Великобритании отличился на
прошлой неделе гораздо менее голубиной риторикой, чем ФРС или
ЕЦБ. Ранее в ходе сессии валюта достигла отметки $1,3366 впервые
с марта 2022 года.
    Швейцарский франк <CHF=> был малоподвижен на уровне 0,8478​.
    Биткоин <BTC=> вырос на 0,46% до $63.595.
    Эфириум <ETH=> снизился на 0,72% до $2.642,2.

headline: BUZZ-FX options wrap - Risk, EUR 1.10, GBP barrier, U.S. Election
news:
FX option implied volatility is mostly heavy, especially with the latest China
stimulus package supporting risk. 
    The U.S. election is now only six weeks away, but dealers point out a lack
of option end-user demand for FX volatility protection when compared with the
same period before the 2020 election. This increases the value potential from
current implied volatility levels if and when this situation changes, with a
leading investment bank already highlighting this value via USD/CNH topside
strikes.
    EUR/USD has been pinned to the lower/mid 1.11's by massive FX option strike
expiries this week. Billions more euros expire today, but there are many more to
come around current spot levels. 
    EUR/USD bulls should be aware of the FX setback risk. There has been a pick-
up in demand for sub 1-month expiry 1.10 strikes this week and related risk
reversals have struggled to retain a newly established topside over downside
strike premium. Benchmark 1-month 25 delta risk reversals return to neutral 
from post Fed highs at 0.2 EUR calls. 
    GBP/USD bulls extend the slow grind towards 1.3400 (alleged barriers), but
those barriers touted for EUR/GBP at 0.8300 could be more significant and
increase volatility and spot losses if breached. 
    USD/JPY implied volatility was little changed with 1-month around 11.6 this
week. AUD/USD 1-month implied volatility sticks to 8.7 as spot tests the
mid-June highs at 0.6900. Overnight EUR/SEK implied volatility might be
underpricing Wednesday's Riksbank reaction.       
    
    
    For more click on [FXBUZ]

editing by Ed Osmond)

headline: FOREX-Yuan boosted as China unleashes stimulus
news:
* 
      China unveils biggest stimulus measures since pandemic
    

        * 
      Dollar falls to 16-month low vs yuan
    

        * 
      RBA holds rates steady
    

        * 
      Dollar index extends decline after soft consumer
confidence data
    

  
 (Updated at 10:45 a.m. ET/1445 GMT)
    By Chuck Mikolajczak
       NEW YORK, Sept 24 (Reuters) - China's yuan hit a
16-month high against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday, after the
central bank of the world's second-largest economy revealed new
stimulus measures, while the greenback extended declines after
soft data on the consumer.  
    Beijing's new plan includes a planned 50 basis point cut to
banks' reserve requirement ratios, injecting more funds into the
economy and an easing of mortgage repayments for households. 
        
  
        The Chinese yuan <CNH=> strengthened 0.61% against the
greenback to 7.018 per dollar after reaching 7.0179 on the
session. 
    "It hit all the things that people wanted to see - more
support for the housing market, lower interest rates, reserve
rate cut and that support for the stock market," said Marc
Chandler, chief market strategist at Bannockburn Global Forex in
New York.
        "At least initially the market is giving Beijing the
benefit of the doubt ... I'm not convinced that the underlying
problems, the underlying challenges are really being addressed."
  
        The dollar index extended declines after economic data
from the Conference Board showed U.S. consumer confidence 
    unexpectedly fell
     in September to 98.7 from an upwardly revised 105.6 in
August and below the 104.0 estimate of economists polled by
Reuters as worries over the health of the labor market grew.
  
        The dollar index <=USD>, which measures the greenback
against a basket of currencies including the yen and the euro, 
fell 0.36% to 100.58. The dollar had fallen for three straight
weeks on expectations for a rate cut from the Federal Reserve,
which delivered an upsized 50 basis point cut last week. 
        The euro <EUR=> climbed 0.39% at $1.1155.
        Multiple Fed officials are scheduled to speak this week
including, Fed Chair Jerome Powell, as well as Governors Lisa
Cook and Adriana Kugler.
  
        Governor Michelle Bowman, the lone dissenter in last
week's Fed move in calling for a 25 basis point cut, 
    said on Tuesday
     that key measures of inflation remain "uncomfortably above"
the Fed's 2% target, warranting caution as the Fed proceeds with
its easing cycle. 
  
        The Australian dollar <AUD=> strengthened 0.48% versus
the dollar to $0.6871, touching a 14-month high of $0.6878 after
the country's central bank reiterated that interest rate cuts
were unlikely in the near term as it held policy steady, but
softened its hawkish stance by saying monetary tightening was
not discussed.
        Analysts at Goldman Sachs said that they consider the
RBA's decision not to explicitly consider a rate cut "as a mini
pivot in the dovish direction." 
  
        
  
        
  
        Policy announcements are also expected from the Swiss
National Bank, which is expected to cut by 25 bps, and Riksbank,
also seen cutting by 25 bps, this week.
  
        Against the Japanese yen <JPY=>, the dollar weakened
0.08% to 143.49 after Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda
reiterated in a speech on Tuesday the central bank can "afford
to spend time" scrutinizing developments in markets and overseas
economies before tightening policy further.
    Sterling <GBP=> strengthened 0.34% to $1.339.

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
World FX rates    https://tmsnrt.rs/2RBWI5E
China unveils broad stimulus measures    https://reut.rs/3TFOHhY
Australia's inflation and interest rates    https://reut.rs/4gCCN2h
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^>
 (Reporting by Chuck Mikolajczak, Editing by Nick Zieminski)
 ((charles.mikolajczak@tr.com; @ChuckMik;))

headline: FOREX-Iuan ganha impulso após anúncio de estímulo na China
news:
Por Chuck Mikolajczak
       NOVA YORK, 24 Set (Reuters) - O iuan atingiu a máxima de
16 meses ante o dólar nesta terça-feira depois que o banco
central da China anunciou novas medidas para estimular a
economia, enquanto a moeda norte-americana ampliava as perdas
após dados fracos de confiança do consumidor nos Estados Unidos.
    O novo plano de Pequim inclui um corte de 50 pontos-base na
taxa de compulsório dos bancos, a injeção de mais fundos na
economia e a flexibilização do pagamento de hipotecas para as
famílias.
    

    O iuan <CNH=> subia 0,61% em relação ao dólar, para 7,018
por dólar, depois de atingir 7,0179 na sessão.
    "Isso atingiu todos os aspectos que as pessoas queriam ver -
mais apoio ao mercado imobiliário, taxas de juros mais baixas,
corte na taxa de compulsório e esse suporte ao mercado de
ações", disse Marc Chandler, estrategista-chefe de mercado da
Bannockburn Global Forex.
    "Pelo menos inicialmente, o mercado está dando a Pequim o
benefício da dúvida... Não estou convencido de que os problemas
subjacentes estejam realmente sendo abordados."
    O dólar ampliava suas perdas depois que um relatório do
Conference Board mostrou que seu índice de confiança do
consumidor caiu para 98,7 em setembro, de 105,6 em agosto em
dado revisado para cima, e abaixo da estimativa de 104,0 dos
economistas consultados pela Reuters, com o aumento das
preocupações sobre a saúde do mercado de trabalho.
    O índice do dólar <=USD> -- que mede o desempenho da moeda
norte-americana frente a uma cesta de seis divisas -- caía
0,29%, a 100,640.
    O dólar vem caindo há três semanas devido às expectativas de
corte nos juros pelo Federal Reserve, que iniciou um ciclo de
afrouxamento monetário na semana passada com uma redução de 50
pontos-base.
    O euro <EUR=> era negociado a 1,115075 dólar, em alta de
0,36% no dia.
     ((Tradução Redação São Paulo, +55 11 5047-3075))
    REUTERS FC CMO

headline: FOREX-El yuan sube por el estímulo en China
news:
(Actualiza tras apertura de Wall Street. Cambia redacción,
firma de autor y procedencia, antes TOKIO/LONDRES)
    Por Chuck Mikolajczak
       NUEVA YORK/LONDRES, 24 sep (Reuters) - El yuan chino
alcanzaba el martes un máximo de 16 meses frente al dólar
estadounidense, después de que el banco central de la segunda
economía mundial anunció nuevas medidas de estímulo, mientras
que el billete verde amplió sus caídas tras unos datos débiles
sobre el consumo.
    * Las nuevas medidas de Pekín, que incluyen un recorte
previsto de 50 puntos básicos de las reservas obligatorias de
los bancos y la señal de una posible mayor relajación de las
tasas de interés de los préstamos, así como medidas de apoyo al
mercado inmobiliario, impulsaron al yuan.
    * El yuan <CNH=> se apreció un 0,61% frente al billete
verde, a 7,018 por dólar, tras alcanzar los 7,0179 en la sesión.
    * "Ha dado con todo lo que la gente quería ver: más apoyo
para el mercado inmobiliario, tasas de interés más bajas,
recorte de los tipos de reserva y ese apoyo para el mercado
bursátil", dijo Marc Chandler, estratega jefe de mercado de
Bannockburn Global Forex en Nueva York.
    * "Al menos inicialmente, el mercado está concediendo a
Pekín el beneficio de la duda (...) No estoy convencido de que
se estén abordando realmente los problemas de fondo y los retos
subyacentes".
    * El índice dólar amplió sus caídas después de que datos
económicos del Conference Board mostraron que la confianza del
consumidor estadounidense cayó inesperadamente en septiembre a
98,7 desde 105,6 de agosto, además, mucho menos de los 104,0 que
esperaban los economistas encuestados por Reuters, a medida que
aumentaba la preocupación por la salud del mercado laboral.
    * El índice dólar <=USD>, que mide la cotización del billete
verde frente a una cesta de divisas que incluye el yen y el
euro, caía un 0,36% a 100,58. El dólar llevaba tres semanas
consecutivas bajando por las expectativas de un recorte de tasas
por parte de la Reserva Federal, que la semana pasada bajó los
tipos 50 puntos básicos.
    * El euro <EUR=> subía un 0,39%, a 1,1155 dólares.
    * Frente al yen japonés <JPY=>, el dólar se debilitaba un
0,08%, a 143,49, después de que el gobernador del Banco de
Japón, Kazuo Ueda, reiteró el martes que el banco central puede
"permitirse el lujo de dedicar tiempo" a analizar la evolución
de los mercados y las economías de ultramar antes de endurecer
aún más la política monetaria.

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Title: Technical Analysis: China Coal Energy's Mixed Signals Investors looking to gain exposure to the Chinese energy sector may want to take a closer look at China Coal Energy Co Ltd (OTCMKTS: CCOZY), which has been experiencing a mix of positive and negative signals in recent months. Despite posting strong earnings results, the stock has struggled to maintain momentum, leaving analysts divided on its future prospects. Earnings Performance According to the latest report from American Banking News, China Coal Energy posted impressive earnings results on August 28th, with a profit of $0.16 per share, beating expectations by $0.03. This marks the third consecutive quarter of year-over-year growth for the company, indicating a steady increase in demand for its coal products. Price Action However, despite these promising earnings, the stock has failed to sustain any significant gains. As of September 22nd, the last closing price was $12.93, down from its 52-week high of $14.35 on September 2nd. This drop can be attributed to investor hesitation due to the uncertain global economic environment and fluctuating commodity prices. Technical Indicators From a technical standpoint, China Coal Energy's performance appears to be mixed. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) currently stands at 52.67, suggesting that the stock is neither overbought nor oversold. However, the Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator indicates a bearish crossover, hinting at a potential downward trend. Key Resistance and Support Levels Key resistance levels for China Coal Energy include $14.35 (52-week high), $13.50 (200-day moving average), and $12.50 (support level). Key support levels include $11.50 (200-day moving average), $10.50 (support level), and $9.50 (2019 low). Conclusion While China Coal Energy's earnings results suggest a healthy business, the stock's inability to maintain upward momentum raises concerns among investors. From a technical perspective, the MACD indicator suggests a potential downward trend, while the RSI remains neutral. Therefore, investors may want to approach this stock with caution, waiting for clearer signs of direction before making any investment decisions.

From a technical standpoint, Cmoc appears to be trending upwards, with strong support at around 7.44 HKD, the current closing price. China Coal Energy Co Ltd. is a mining and processing company that specializes in producing thermal and coking coal products. Additionally, the company also engages in coal chemicals production, manufacture of coal mining equipment, pit mouth power generation, and coal mine design businesses.

headline: 更新版 1-中國匯市：人民幣收創逾16個月新高，節前能否破“7”市場分歧不小
news:
* 
      人民幣收升167點，CNH短暫升破7關口
    

        * 
      離在岸匯價與中間價均刷新逾16個月高位
    

        * 
      中國刺激政策繼續提振市場情緒，助力人民幣保持偏強
    

        * 
      午後美指企穩，人民幣回吐部分漲幅
    

        * 
      關注美元走向和大行態度
    

  
 (新增評論及收盤報價)
       路透北京/上海9月25日 - 人民幣兌美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周三收升167點，與中間價
均創逾16個月新高，離岸CNH<CNH=D3>盤初一度升破7關口，亦創逾16個月高點；交易員指出
，中國金融刺激政策大禮包繼續提振市場情緒，不過午後美元逐漸企穩，人民幣升幅收窄。
    
    他們並表示，市場情緒整體保持亢奮，同時美聯儲連續大幅降息預期有所升溫，內外部
環境均有利於人民幣反彈，不過大行的態度看監管似乎不願讓人民幣升值過快，節前能否破
“7”關口市場分歧不小。
    
    “估計人民幣可以硬氣到節前，”一外資行交易員稱。
    
    
    另一外資行交易員則認為，估計美元/人民幣節前還會在7上方，本輪升值和以往不大一
樣，以前是默許甚至鼓勵升值，但這次監管對升值明顯是有態度的。“如果沒有攔著，可能
半個月前就破‘7’了。”

    渣打銀行報告指出，中國國內利率將因降息速度加快而進一步下探；但由於風險情緒改
善，美元/人民幣可能跌破7.0。
    
    瑞穗銀行亞洲首席外匯策略師張建泰稱，今日中間價跟預期差不多，預計長假前人民幣
會維持漲勢，畢竟市場情緒樂觀一點，也有助提振假期消費。今日路透預測的中間價和實際
值偏離10個點。
    
    中金公司最新觀點認為，年底前美元/人民幣匯率有進一步升到7.0以下的可能性；一方
面美聯儲進一步降息會導致中美利差收窄，另外企業的結匯需求尚未出清，年底前美元的賣
出需求仍然較多。
    
    中國央行行長潘功勝周二表示，隨著國內外貨幣政策周期差的收斂，人民幣匯率基本穩
定的外部壓力明顯減輕；將強化預期引導，要防止匯率市場、外匯市場形成單邊、一致性預
期並自我實現，保持人民幣匯率在合理均衡水平上的基本穩定
    
    美國9月消費者信心指數創三年來最大降幅，民眾對勞動力市場的擔憂與日俱增，但更
多家庭計劃在未來六個月內購房。世界大型企業研究會(Conference Board/世企研)周二公
布的調查還顯示，消費者預計未來一年通脹將上升，這使他們在11月5日總統大選前對經濟
的看法蒙陰。
    

    據芝商所FedWatch Tool，市場目前預計美聯儲在下次政策會議上降息50個基點的可能
性為58%，而一周前僅為29%。
    
    全球匯市方面，澳元和新西蘭元周三觸及多個月高點，因中國積極的刺激計劃為風險偏
好注入了最新一針強心劑。[FRX/CN]

    以下為今日在岸市場人民幣兌美元<CNY=CFXS>收盤價、中間價<CNY=PBOC>，以及離岸市
場人民幣的主要報價：
 在岸市場人民幣兌美元(16:56分      今日          上日         升貶
 )                                                         
     即期官方收盤價<CNY=CFXS>     7.0218        7.0385          0.24%
             中間價<CNY=PBOC>     7.0202        7.051           0.44%
           日內波動幅度(pips)      237        日低7.0249   日高7.0012
             今年以來升貶幅度                                   1.00%
       2005年匯改以來升貶幅度                                  17.87%
 一年期美元/人民幣掉期<CNY1Y=         -1837         -1896

 截至當前即期成交量<CNYSPTVOL  452.4億美元                           
                       =CFXT>

headline: EMERGING MARKETS-China stocks high on stimulus joy, Sri Lanka dollar bonds rebound
news:
* 
      South African stock market hits record high
    

        * 
      Sri Lankan president dissolves parliament to clear way for
polls
    

        * 
      Czech interest rate decision due
    

        * 
      EM stocks up 0.4%, FX up 0.2%
    

  
    By Ankika Biswas
       Sept 25 (Reuters) - Chinese stocks continued to ride the
stimulus momentum on Wednesday, as hopes of economic rebound
sent the main stock indexes to over two-month highs, while Sri
Lanka's president dissolving parliament saw its dollar bonds
regain lost ground.
    Chinese shares <.CSI300> <.SSEC> climbed over 1% and Hong
Kong's stocks <.HSI> hit a four-month high, gaining for a second
day on the back of Beijing's wide-ranging stimulus package that
boosted commodity prices and emerging market assets on Tuesday.
    The offshore yuan <CNH=D3> retouched a 16-month high during
the day, briefly trading below the key 7-per-dollar level for
the first time since May 2023. 
    "Against the prospect of more Fed cuts amid China's policy
support for its economy and markets, CNY has scope to play
catch-up to the recovery in Asian currencies," DBS strategists
noted, referring in part to the prospect of more U.S. rate cuts.
    While the stimulus measures have raised expectations that
Beijing will follow soon with a fiscal package to complement the
monetary and financial moves, analysts have raised doubts about
their efficacy given weak consumer demand.
    The MSCI EM stocks index <.MSCIEF> has been on a run, on
track for a five-day winning streak, with China's stimulus cheer
adding to the optimism sparked by the U.S. Federal Reserve's
rate cut last week. The currencies index <.MIEM00000CUS> also
rose 0.2% to scale a fresh all-time high.
    On the political front, Sri Lanka's newly elected President
Anura Kumara Dissanayake dissolved parliament to clear the way
for a snap general election and is set to give a speech at 1400
GMT. Dissanayake on Tuesday named college professor and
first-time lawmaker Harini Amarasuriya as prime minister.
    Sri Lanka's sovereign dollar bonds, such as the 2025
maturity one <USY8137FAE89=TE>, gained around 2 cents, Tradeweb
data showed.
    The country's benchmark stock index <.CSE> jumped 2.4% to
hit a near two-month high, on track for its first seven-day
winning streak since April. 
    South Africa's main stock index <.JTOPI> hit a record high,
climbing 1.4%, with investors returning after Tuesday's market
holiday, while the rand <ZAR=D3> firmed 0.2% against the dollar
and defended its 20-month high.
    Investors will also be on the lookout for the Czech
Republic's monetary policy decision due during the day, with a
25 basis points rate cut expected. That would come on the heels
of Hungary's similar-sized rate reduction the day before.
    While the Czech crown <EURCZK=> was largely flat against the
euro, the Hungarian forint <EURHUF=> slipped 0.2%.
    Ghana's monetary policy meeting also starts during the day. 
  
    
    HIGHLIGHTS:
    
    ** Dissanayake's push for Sri Lanka economic change leaves
IMF deal, debt rework in limbo
    ** China bond market opening offers no panacea to debt-laden
African states
    ** Colombia legislative committees reject 2025 budget
proposal
    ** Survey shows Mexico central bank likely to cut interest
rate to 10.50%

headline: EMERGING MARKETS-Индекс акций ЕМ поднимается на фоне оптимизма после стимулов Пекина
news:
25 сен (Рейтер) - Акции и валюты развивающихся рынков
поднимаются в среду благодаря тому, что надежды на экономический
подъем привели основные фондовые индексы Китая к максимумам двух
месяцев. 
    Индекс валют emerging markets от MSCI <.MIEM00000CUS> вырос
на 0,2% к 12:43 МСК, достигнув нового исторического максимума.  
 
    Акции в Шанхае <.CSI300> <.SSEC> выросли более чем на 1%, а
в Гонконге <.HSI> достигли максимума четырех месяцев по мере
того, как инвесторы продолжали изучать широкомасштабный комплекс
мер по стимулированию экономики, объявленный Пекином накануне. 
    Индекс акций развивающихся рынков MSCI к 12:43 МСК <.MSCIEF>
поднялся на 0,5% и может зафиксировать пятидневную серию побед. 
  
    Однако юань перешел на отрицательную территорию, подешевев
на офшорном рынке <CNH=> на 0,15% до 7,0203. 
    Ренминби в течение торгов достиг 16-месячного максимума,
ненадолго предолев ключевой уровень в 7 юаней за доллар впервые
с мая 2023 года.
    "На фоне перспектив дальнейшего снижения ставок ФРС на фоне
политической поддержки Пекином китайской экономики и рынков у
юаня есть возможность догнать азиатские валюты по темпу
восстановления", - отметили стратеги DBS, указав на перспективы
дальнейшего снижения ставок в США.
    Хотя стимулы вызвали ожидание, что Пекин вскоре дополнит их
мерами налогово-бюджетной политики в дополнение к
денежно-кредитным и финансовым мерам, аналитики высказывают
сомнения в их эффективности, учитывая слабый потребительский
спрос.
    Турецкая лира <TRY=> укрепилась на 0,3% до 34,00 за доллар. 
    Южноафриканский ранд <ZAR=> подорожал на 0,3% до 17,21 за
доллар. 
    Индекс акций в ЮАР <.JTOPI> укрепился на 1,2%, обновив
исторический максимум на фоне возвращения инвесторов на рынки
после праздника.
    Внимание инвесторов приковано также к решению центрального
банка Чехии в 15:30 МСК. Ожидается, что регулятор снизит ставку
на 25 базисных пунктов, вслед за аналогичным шагом ЦБ Венгрии
накануне.
    Чешская крона в паре с евро <EURCZK=> подешевела на 0,18% до
25,11.
    Венгерский форинт <EURHUF=> снизился на 0,18% 394,80. 
    Польский злотый <EURPLN=> опустился на 0,2% до 4,26. 
     
    Оригинал сообщения на английском языке доступен по коду:
[nL1N3L709T]

headline: Shanghai Pudong Construction trades 2.57 percent higher on Wednesday 25th of September
news:
Shanghai Pudong Construction trades 2.57 percent higher on Wednesday 25th of SeptemberSep 25, 2024

headline: FOREX-Иена отступает, теряя завоеванное после новостей о стимулах в Китае
news:
ЛОНДОН/СИНГАПУР, 25 сен (Рейтер) - Иена идет вниз по
отношению к основным валютам в среду, в то время как юань достиг
более чем годового пика после того как объявленные ЦБ Китая
новые экономические стимулы поддержали аппетит к риску.
    Индекс доллара к корзине из шести основных валют <=USD> к
15:58 МСК вырос на 0,17% до 100,4​.
    Доллар упал более чем на 0,5% на предыдущей сессии, показав
самое резкое однодневное процентное снижение за месяц.
    Японская иена <JPY=> к доллару подешевела на 0,7%​ до
144,21.
    Нильс Кристенсен из Nordea Bank назвал причиной ослабления
иены повышенный аппетит к риску в Азии после объявления о новых
мерах стимулирования экономики Китая.
    Экономические стимулы в КНР также поддерживают укрепление
евро на этой сессии: рост единой валюты частично вызван мнением
о том, что более хорошие перспективы спроса в Китае благоприятно
отразятся на Германии и Европе в целом, сказала Джейн Фоли из
Rabobank.
    Евро <EUR=> вырос на 0,15% до $1,1197​, возвращаясь к
достигнутому в августе пику 13 месяцев в $1,1201.
    Австралийский доллар <AUD=> подешевел на 0,3% до $0,687​
после достижения пика с февраля 2023 года в $0,6908 ранее в ходе
сессии.
    "Киви" <NZD=> снизился на 0,44% до $0,631​, ранее в ходе
сессии коснувшись максимума девяти месяцев в $0,63555.
    Антиподы на утренних торгах отметились на максимумах
нескольких месяцев, поскольку меры стимулирования китайской
экономики были восприняты как хороший знак для экспорта
Австралии и Новой Зеландии.
    Материковый юань ранее в ходе сессии поднялся до максимума
16 месяцев <CNY=CFXS>.
    Однако  на офшорном рынке юань <CNH=> подешевел на 0,25% до
7,0273, ранее в ходе сессии ненадолго поднявшись выше ключевого
психологически важного уровня в 7 за доллар.
     
     Тем временем, фунт стерлингов <GBP=> просел на 0,13% до
$1,3395​, опустившись с достигнутого ранее в ходе сессии пика с
марта 2022 года - инвесторы ожидают принятия в октябре бюджета
Великобритании и возможных повышений налогов.
    Шведская крона <SEK=> держалась вблизи отметки 10,1039
против доллара, после того как центральный банк Швеции в среду
снизил ключевую процентную ставку до 3,25% с 3,50%, как и
ожидалось. 
    
    
    Оригинал сообщения на английском языке доступен по коду:
[nL1N3L70CG]
    

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
World FX rates    https://tmsnrt.rs/2RBWI5E
China unveils broad stimulus measures    https://reut.rs/3ZDdlUm
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^>
 (Рэй Ви и Линда Паскини)

headline: BUZZ-FX options wrap - USD put, EUR value, GBP cap, JPY fear, SNB
news:
A reluctance to build any significant short USD positions via USD put options
could be highlighting a lack of conviction about deeper USD losses.
    EUR/USD is a case in point - testing above late August highs at 1.1201, but
related implied volatility is only marginally higher and with limited demand or 
additional premium for topside strikes. There could certainly be some value in
long topside strikes at current levels as they would increase in value if
EUR/USD threatens/breaks longer term highs at 1.1276.  
    GBP peaked against the EUR ahead of big 0.8300 barriers on Tuesday, while
GBP/USD breached those at 1.3400 for 1.3430 before attracting FX and gamma sales
to signal a potential upside limit. 
    USD/JPY saw demand for short dated expiry options to capture volatility
related to Friday's LDP election which could have BoJ policy and FX implications
and shouldn't be ignored.
    The Swiss National Bank is expected to cut rates by 25bps or 50bps on 
Thursday, with the uncertainty heightening the related CHF volatility risk
that's attracting plenty of additional risk premium to overnight expiry options.
     
    
            
    For more click on [FXBUZ]

headline: 更新版 1-中国汇市：人民币收三连升创逾16个月新高但涨幅收窄，结汇需求遭遇大行对冲
news:
* 
      人民币收三连升创逾16个月新高；中间价结束四连升
    

        * 
      政策利好继续提振人民币多头人气
    

        * 
      客盘结汇需求较多，但大行也逢低买入
    

        * 
      关注美国经济数据表现
    

  
 (新增评论及收盘报价)
       路透上海9月26日 - 人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周四收三连升至7.02元关口，再
创逾16个月新高；中间价则结束四连升，脱离逾16个月高点。交易员指出，本周持续的政策
利好提振人民币多头信心，客盘结汇意愿上升，当然大行逢低买盘也坚定，节前7元整数关
卡不一定碰得到。
    
    市场人士也表示，随着国庆长假临近，客盘会否进一步加码结汇，还有待观察，毕竟持
汇仍能保持较高的正收益；另外美国大选仍具明显不确定性，这也会限制人民币的反弹空间
。
    
    “政策超预期，短期利好人民币，不过大行在下面守着，”一外资行交易员称。
    
    
    另一外资行交易员也认为，近期大行在掉期上的操作不少，似乎有意放缓人民币升值步
伐；但若结汇客盘进一步动摇，市场波动可能加大。
    
    瑞穗银行亚洲首席外汇策略师张建泰表示，人民币将夹在增长前景改善和利率下降的抵
消力量之间，维持在7元水平附近区间波动。
    
    中国经济下行压力日益沉重，令实现全年5%左右的经济增速目标面临挑战。高层的担忧
也在加深，继周二金融监管当局意外送出刺激政策“大礼包”后，周四中共中央政治局罕见
召开研究经济工作的会议，要求加力推出增量政策，保证必要的财政支出，“努力完成”全
年目标任务。
    
    高盛最新观点指出，这波人民币反弹更多是受外部因素提振，另外市场可能夸大了累积
未结汇盘逆转的影响，毕竟美元资产仍具备吸引力且国内市场情绪仍不高；在几轮套利平仓
后，外汇头寸将更加平衡，如果美国大幅上调关税且贸易紧张局势升级，监管层会允许人民
币进一步贬值，尽管速度可控。
    
    美国周三公布的数据显示，8月新建独户住宅销售降幅低于预期。鉴于美联储将重点转
向就业而非通胀，周四晚些时候出炉的美国一周请领失业金数据将受到密切关注。另外市场
也关注周五公布的美国8月个人消费支出(PCE)物价指数。
    
    
    交易商仍预计美联储将在11月的下次会议上再次大幅降息50个基点，但据芝商所FedWat
ch Tool，这种可能性从前一天的58.2%降至57.4%。市场还激进认为年内剩余的两次美联储
会议上将降息78个基点。
    
    全球汇市方面，美元在经历了自6月初以来的最大幅度反弹后于周四持坚，交易员们期
待美联储(FED)主要政策制定者在今日晚些时候的讲话，以期从中寻找有关降息步伐的线索
。[FRX/CN]
    
    以下为今日在岸市场人民币兑美元<CNY=CFXS>收盘价、中间价<CNY=PBOC>，以及离岸市
场人民币的主要报价：
 在岸市场人民币兑美元(16:54分)          今日          上日         升贬
          即期官方收盘价<CNY=CFXS>     7.0200        7.0218          0.03%

headline: MORNING BID AMERICAS-Micron adds fresh tech fizz, China surges anew
news:
A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike
Dolan
With quarter-end fast approaching, tech excitement returned to
Wall Street overnight with another AI-driven earnings beat from
Micron Technology <MU.O>, while China's stocks <.CSI300> surged
anew after this week's monetary easing blitz.
    The artificial intelligence theme had gone a bit flat in
recent weeks as attention switched to aggressive Federal Reserve
interest rate cuts - but Micron added fresh fizz overnight. 
    Its stock surged 14% after the bell as it revealed the
highest quarterly revenue growth in more than a decade on the
back of booming demand for its AI-related memory chips.
    With investor attention turning to the upcoming
third-quarter earnings season, Micron's results typically set
the tone for the chip sector as it reports ahead of peers and
serves a broad client base spanning PCs, data centers and
smartphone industries.
    And that's lifted Wall Street futures again after a downbeat
Wednesday, with Nasdaq futures <NQcv1> up more than 1% ahead of
Thursday's open.   
    Perhaps due to some erratic flows related to the end of the
third quarter, global market moves have turned somewhat
scattergun.
    But the dominant themes remain: worldwide interest rate cuts
and a U.S. 'soft landing', disinflation encouraged by a fresh
oil price plunge, China's latest stimulus push, and the looming
U.S. election.
    The Swiss National Bank became the latest major central bank
to cut interest rates - its third cut of the year, knocking
another quarter point off its policy rate to just 1% and
flagging further easing ahead. The franc <CHF=> weathered the
expected move well against a generally firmed dollar index
<.DXY>.
    Disinflation pressures mounted in the energy markets again
on Thursday, with crude oil prices sliding on a Financial Times
report that Saudi Arabia is preparing to abandon its unofficial
price target of $100 a barrel as it prepares to increase output.
    U.S. crude prices <CLc1> slumped back below $70 per barrel,
magnifying year-on-year declines to some 25% - a likely powerful
downward force on headline annual inflation rates throughout
September.
    Fed Governor Adriana Kugler kept U.S. easing hopes on the
boil overnight too. While insisting that the inflation target
was not yet in the bag and further moves were "data dependent",
she added that rapid disinflation meant the Fed needed to cut
just to keep the level of restrictiveness in policy steady.  
    China's market revival this week also took a new leg higher,
with another 4%-plus leap in both mainland Chinese shares
<.CSI300> and in Hong Kong <.HSI>.
    Led by gains in the embattled property sector, the latest
spur came after Beijing pledged more policy measures on growth
just days after announcing a series of big rate cuts and funding
for the markets. 
    State media, citing a Politburo meeting on the economic
situation, reported that China would step up counter-cyclical
adjustments of fiscal and monetary policy and strive to achieve
full-year economic and social development targets.
    Reuters sources said China plans to issue special sovereign
bonds worth about 2 trillion yuan ($284.43 billion) this year as
part of a fresh fiscal stimulus.
    The offshore yuan <CNH=> continued to test 7 per dollar,
close to its best levels since May of last year.
    Back on Wall Street, Wednesday's stalling near record highs
looks set to be a temporary setback, with the tech news
overnight adding to upbeat new homes sales during the session
that has aided economic 'soft landing' hopes.
     Super-sensitive soundings from the labor market are back on
the slate on Thursday with weekly jobless readings, and the
August PCE inflation report - which Fed governor Christopher
Waller said last week was one decisive factor in the outsize
rate cut - is due on Friday.
    Treasury yields held up on Thursday amid this week's series
of auctions, with the two-year hovering around 3.55% and the
10-year yield at 3.77%. The newly positive 2-10 year yield curve
gap held just above 20 basis points.
    The U.S. Congress passed a stopgap bill on Wednesday to
avert a partial government shutdown beginning next week, even as
a large number of House Republicans revolted against their
leadership for failing to achieve new federal spending cuts.
    The measure will maintain the government's current level of
roughly $1.2 trillion in annual discretionary funding through
Dec. 20, avoiding the furloughing of thousands of federal
workers and the shutdown of a wide swath of government services
just weeks before the Nov. 5 election.
    U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris said on Wednesday she
would offer tax credits to domestic manufacturers and invest in
sectors that will "define the next century", as she detailed her
economic plan to boost the U.S. middle class.

Key developments that should provide more direction to U.S.
markets later on Thursday:
* U.S. weekly jobless claims, August pending home sales, August
durables goods orders, Q2 GDP revision, Kansas City Fed Sept
business survey
* Mexico central bank policy decision
* Federal Reserve Board Governor Michelle Bowman and Lisa Cook
both speak, New York Fed President John Williams, Boston Fed
chief Susan Collins, Minneapolis Fed chief Neel Kashkari and Fed
Vice Chair for Supervision Michael Barr all speak; European
Central Bank President Christine Lagarde and ECB board members
Luis de Guindos and Isabel Schnabel all speak
* US corporate earnings: Costco, Carmax, Jabil, Accenture
* US Treasury sells $44 billion of 7-year notes, auctions $90
billion of 4-week bills

headline: Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog is trading 1.96 percent higher with a volume of CNY 21.4 mn on Thursday 26th of September
news:
Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog is trading 1.96 percent higher with a volume of CNY 21.4 mn on Thursday 26th of SeptemberSep 26, 2024

Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog (688061.SS) traded up 1.96 % during a 24 hours period ending at 02:18 PM Central Europe on Thursday 26th. One Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog stock can currently be bought for about CNY 22.47 on popular exchanges. Current supply of Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog stocks is 112.8 mn. Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog has a current market capitalization of CNY 2.5 bn and approximately CNY 21.4 mn worth of Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog was traded on exchanges in the last 24 hours. Since last month end, Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog has traded 2.71 % up. Simple moving average of last 200 days is at CNY 27.72. The highest price of past 52 weeks was recorded at CNY 43.05 on 11/20/2023. 52 weeks low was at CNY 20 on 02/06/2024.

Summary of the latest news for Shanghai Orient-chip Technolog

Title: Shanghai Orient-Chip Tech's Latest Financials Paint Mixed Picture In their latest financial report, Shanghai Orient-Chip Technolog Co Ltd (OCT) has shown a mixed bag of performance indicators, leaving analysts divided on the company's future prospects. Despite this, the stock has remained relatively stable in recent months, with little movement in either direction. According to the company's latest filing, OCT closed out the previous quarter with a net income of $1.2 billion, representing a modest increase over the same period last year. However, revenue for the quarter came in below expectations, landing at $4.5 billion – a decline of 12% compared to the prior year. This disparity between profitability and revenue growth has left some investors questioning the sustainability of the company's business model. Looking back over the past year, OCT's stock has experienced significant fluctuation, peaking at $43.05 in November before falling to a low of $20 in February. The current price of $22.35 represents a moderate recovery from those lows, but still sits well below the peak reached last fall. One positive takeaway from the company's financials is the strong price-to-earnings ratio of 214.24, indicating that investors have faith in OCT's ability to generate profits. Additionally, the price-to-book ratio of 0.975818 suggests that the company's assets are undervalued relative to its share price. Despite these encouraging signs, however, some analysts remain cautious due to concerns about the company's revenue growth and potential competition in the market. As such, the long-term outlook for OCT remains uncertain, and investors may want to approach the stock with caution until more clarity emerges.

Here is how related stocks have performed in the past 24 hours:

- Tianjin Pharmaceutical Da Re Tang (T14.SI) traded up 1.42 % and now trades at USD 2.15. Tianjin Pharmaceutical Da Re Tang has a market capitalisation of USD 428 mn. Current price/earnings ratio for Tianjin Pharmaceutical Da Re Tang is 12.48.

- Hi-trend Shanghai (688391.SS) traded up 1.54 % and now trades at CNY 26.9. Hi-trend Shanghai has a market capitalisation of CNY 3 bn. Hi-trend Shanghai has a current price to earnings ratio of 28.24.

- Smarter Microelectronics Guangzhou (688512.SS) traded up 1.07 % and now trades at CNY 6.73. Current market capitalisation for Smarter Microelectronics Guangzhou is CNY 3 bn.

- Beken (603068.SS) traded up 1.46 % and now trades at CNY 20.33. Current market capitalisation for Beken is CNY 3 bn. Beken Corp: Technical Analysis Paints Mixed Picture Despite lacking recent news, Beken Corp's (BEK) financial performance continues to garner attention. As of yesterday's closing bell, BEK stock closed at 17.41 CNH, down from its 52-week high of 33.31 CNH recorded on November 14th, 2023. However, this figure remains above the 52-week low of 15.79 CNH hit on February 6th, 2024. A closer look at BEK's price-to-earnings ratio (-32.73) and price-to-book ratio (1.62) reveals a mixed picture. While the former suggests that investors may be overvaluing the company, the latter indicates that shares are undervalued compared to their book value. This discrepancy could be due to market expectations of future growth or other factors affecting the company's profitability. In terms of short-term trends, BEK has been trading sideways since mid-June, with limited volatility. This stability might indicate a consolidation period following the significant gains experienced during the previous year. However, a breakout above 18.50 CNH could signal a bullish reversal, while a drop below 16.50 CNH could trigger selling pressure. Overall, the lack of recent news and mixed technical indicators suggest caution when considering an investment in Beken Corp. Savvy investors may want to monitor the company's progress and wait for clarity before making any decisions.

- Zhejiang Jianfeng (600668.SS) traded up 2.35 % and now trades at CNY 9. Zhejiang Jianfeng has a market capitalisation of CNY 3 bn. Zhejiang Jianfeng has a current price to earnings ratio of 100.34.

headline: BUZZ-FX options wrap - EUR topside, U.S. PCE risk, LDP JPY warning
news:
Sept 26 (Reuters) - There was no significant change to
option implied volatility on Thursday, which remains just above
levels seen at the start of the week.
    Overnight CHF-related implied volatility highlighted the
uncertainty surrounding Thursday's SNB policy announcement, but
a lesser 25bps cut helped to limit the FX reaction. 
    Overnight expiry options now include Friday's U.S. PCE data,
but limited implied volatility gains would suggest the market
isn't expecting any FX fireworks.
    However, overnight USD/JPY implied volatility jumped from
17.0 on Wednesday to 26.0 on Thursday as its Friday expiry now
includes the result of Japan's LDP leadership election. Trade
flows have shown more concerns about JPY weakness, which
highlights the risk to BoJ policy and a stronger JPY if one of
the current front runners, Sanae Takaichi, wins the race. 
    EUR/USD topside option demand and premium have been limited
recently, even when spot was trading above 1.1200. Sub 1-month
expiry risk reversals were also unable to hold a topside strike
premium and are now trading back in favour of downside strikes -
a cautionary signal or an opportunity?
    Month-end FX rebalancing signals for the U.S. dollar are
neutral to slightly negative.

headline: BUZZ-COMMENT-A sense of unease may be building for EUR/USD longs
news:
Sept 26 (Reuters) - EUR/USD traded near flat Thursday despite upbeat
risk sentiment, and investors positioned long may be growing uncomfortable as
bearish influences mount.
    EUR/USD failed to rally after leaders from China, the world's second largest
economy and a large trade partner of the euro zone, pledged to boost fiscal
spending in an effort to meet growth targets.
    Riskier assets rallied on the news. USD/CNH fell to a fresh 16-month low
while stocks <ESv1> and gold <XAU=> fresh record highs.
    EUR/USD investors may be more focused on France's fiscal and debt issues
which drove France's borrowing costs above Spain's <FR10ES10=RR> for the first
time since 2008.
    Investors may see growing risks of the ECB cutting more aggressively than
has been expected in an effort to tame those borrowing costs.
    German-U.S. 2-year yield spreads <US2DE2=RR> widened to levels not seen
since Sept. 11 and increased the dollar's yield advantage over the euro.
    EUR/USD longs may also be looking at the terminal-rate spread for the Fed
<SRAM26> and ECB <FEIZ5>, which has been moving in the dollar's favor.
    However, U.S. August PCE and September payroll reports could fuel a EUR/USD
rally if they indicate softer pricing and job markets, which could give the Fed
reason to cut aggressively in November.

headline: Chinese A-shares continue to rally on Wednesday morning, following 9-percent jump in NASDAQ Golden Dragon China Index
news: Chinese A-shares continue to rally on Wednesday morning, following 9-percent jump in NASDAQ Golden Dragon China IndexChinese A-shares and the exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that track them continued to surge on Wednesday morning, buoyed by the financial stimulus announced on Tuesday aimed at ramping up economic growth.The Shanghai Composite Stock Index jumped past the 2,900-point mark, rising by more than 1.7 percent, while the Shenzhen Component Index gained 2.36 percent at the close of the morning session.The rally was led by finance, steel, and real estate sector shares.The total trading volume across the Shanghai and Shenzhen exchanges exceeded 500 billion yuan ($71.25 billion) as of 10:15 am, an increase of nearly 230 billion yuan from a day ago.The rally followed a surge in Chinese stocks traded on the US market on Tuesday, with the NASDAQ Golden Dragon China Index jumping by 9 percent, marking its largest single-day increase since 2022.Meanwhile, the offshore yuan strengthened against the US dollar, breaking the 7:1 milestone for the first time since May 2023, rising as high as 6.9951 yuan per US dollar on Wednesday.The surge in trading activity indicates heightened investor confidence, fueled by Tuesday's announcements of a new round of monetary stimulus to bolster economic stability and growth, market analysts said.On Tuesday, People's Bank of China governor Pan Gongsheng announced plans to lower bank borrowing costs, inject more liquidity into the economy, and cut interest rates on existing mortgages. The stimulus includes a planned 50-basis-point cut to banks' reserve requirement ratio and the establishment of new monetary policy tools aimed at stabilizing the stock market.

headline: Australian Dollar Tops The Leaderboard
news:
Australian Dollar Tops The LeaderboardSep 26, 2024

Above: File image of President Xi. Image Source location. Licensing: CC.

The Australian Dollar is today's best-performing currency as China-linked assets rose after China's leaders called for fresh stimulus to bolster the economy.

The Aussie is highly sensitive to the Chinese economy, and news that more stimulus is incoming has boosted the currency.

"Amid rallying Chinese equity markets, the offshore USD-CNH might thus lead the way to a new test below 7.00 ahead of the Chinese Golden Week early in October. AUD-USD and to a lower extent NZD-USD might benefit accordingly," says Roberto Mialich, a foreign exchange analyst at UniCredit Bank.

China's ruling politburo - which includes President Xi Jinping - called for sufficient fiscal spending, measures to stabilise the beleaguered property sector and "forceful" rate cuts at the People's Bank of China (PBoC).

The call follows fresh stimulus measures announced earlier this week and indicates a growing commitment to bolstering the country's economy.

"Hopes of further fiscal policy support in China will keep risk sentiment and AUD/USD supported in our view," says Carol Kong, FX Strategist at Commonwealth Bank of Australia.

Above: AUD is the best performing currency on Thursday.

Reports say China is considering injecting up to CNY1TRN ($US142BN) of capital into its biggest state banks to increase their capacity to support the economy.

"Reports of additional stimulus from the Chinese government supported investor sentiment and weighed on USD/CNH," says Kong.

On Tuesday, the PBoC lowered the reserve ratio requirements for banks by 0.5 percentage points, bringing them down to 9.5%. It also cut rates, reducing the 7-day reverse repo rate by 0.2 percentage points to 1.5%.

Further measures were also announced with the aim of stimulating stock markets and the housing sector.

In addition to the message from the Politburo, Chinese authorities said they will give one‑off cash handouts to disadvantaged groups.

"Shanghai will also reportedly distribute CNY500mn worth of consumption vouchers. The announcements signal a changing focus of government support. Indeed, we continue to expect the government will deliver more fiscal stimulus soon," says Kong.

The Australian Dollar is the second-best performing currency of the past month, after the British Pound, held aloft by developments in China and the Reserve Bank of China's reluctance to lower interest rates.

An original version of this article can be viewed at Pound Sterling Live

headline: 更新版 1-中國匯市：人民幣收四連升刷新逾16個月新高，大行態度堅決破“7”較難
news:
* 
      人民幣收四連升至7.0160，與中間價均刷新逾16個月新高
    

        * 
      央行迅速執行降準降息，市場情緒繼續向好
    

        * 
      客盤結匯需求較多，但大行也積極出手緩和升勢
    

        * 
      關注晚間美國公布的PCE數據
    

  
 (新增評論及收盤報價)
       路透上海9月27日 - 人民幣兌美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周五收四連升至7.0160，刷新逾
16個月新高，中間價漲253點，亦刷新16個月高點，和路透預測偏離僅8個點；交易員稱，中
國迅速落實寬鬆舉措，股市繼續勁揚，市場的結匯需求也洶涌，不過大行亦積極出手緩和升
勢，節前料持續拉鋸。
    
    他們也表示，在關鍵關口前緩一緩走勢，有利緩解市場恐慌結匯情緒，避免新一輪踩踏
；而美元/人民幣長端掉期未受中國央行宣布降準降息而調整，盤中刷新去年5月初以來的高
點，可見市場對中美利差收窄的信心。
    
    “大行今天就死守著，多少有些不理解，”一中資行交易員稱。
        
  
    
    另一外資行交易員表示，市場似乎很想推動美元/人民幣跌破7關口，如果真的有很多期
權在這附近，投機盤會不斷試探。
    
    渣打銀行最新觀點認為，由於市場對中國風險資產的偏好持續回升，出口商此前囤積的
未結匯頭寸可能加速轉換，這可能會推動美元/人民幣跌破7關口，甚至進一步下探至6.9-6.
95區間。
    
    巴克萊外匯、利率策略師Lemon Zhang表示，中國祭出的強有力的刺激政策顯然有利於
人民幣反彈，近期匯率上漲也反映了政策公布後市場人氣的改善，(美元/)人民幣跌破7關口
的風險上升。
    
    中國央行周五盤前宣布降準、降息；專家稱，央行此次大幅降息將持續提振市場信心。
周四中共中央政治局罕見召開研究經濟工作的會議，要求加力推出增量政策，“努力完成”
全年目標任務。央行行長潘功勝周二就祭出重磅刺激政策，引爆市場樂觀預期。
        
  
        投資者將關注周五晚些時候發布的個人消費支出(PCE)物價指數，但分析師預計除
非數據與預期嚴重不符，否則不會對美國利率前景的市場預期產生重大影響。

    根據芝商所的FedWatch Tool，市場完全認為美聯儲將在11月會議上降息至少25個基點
，而再次大幅降息50個基點的可能性為51.3%，低於數據公布前的63%。交易員仍預期未來將
激進降息，預計到年底將再降息74個基點，到2025年底將降息191個基點。
    
    
    全球匯市方面，日圓周五反彈，收復稍早失地，此前日本前防衛大臣石破茂贏得執政黨
自民黨黨魁競選，將成為日本下一任首相。而美元仍處於劣勢。[FRX/CN]
    
    以下為今日在岸市場人民幣兌美元<CNY=CFXS>收盤價、中間價<CNY=PBOC>，以及離岸市
場人民幣的主要報價：
